$91!! NINE, ONE, off of 100% OLD-VINE Rutherford cabernet, but wait there’s more, yes yes Wine Advocate 93 POINTS - what will you do with it? Not the wine, the $91??!! I’m buying a new cast iron pan, and a duck breast and off to the races. Ah, the good life here at Last Bottle today…!!

WOW! This price is simply breathtaking, seemingly defying general market logic. Beau Vigne (yup, we know you’ve heard the story, but c’mon, it’s winemaker Julien Fayard!!) continues its crazy roll of cabernet goodness with this hot-off-the-press ‘19 (most winemakers here in our Valley will tell you both ‘18 and ‘19 are excellent but ‘19 kicks a little more booty, and is in for the longer haul, with more balance to boot). Beau Vigne has a 100-pointer under its belt and nineteen/twenty wines rated 95-100 points. We are just wicked-lucky to have some. For YOU. Because we love you and this totally, literally is ALL we do.

Dang G! Big guns cab anyway you slice it, with dark, brooding intensity (sorry to use these words like “brooding”, but it evokes a certain personality, right?), deep and complex, festooned (sorry, there we go again) with rich, plush, generous black and blue fruit, a bit of grippy grab-your-tongue Rutherford POWER, sweet, oh-so luscious French oak, cedar, black currants and toasted licorice (is that a thing? That’s what it tastes like) and a bit ‘o’ dark cocoa….MMMM. SEXY! THE PRICE! The heart flutters….

….and it’s gone. Sorry, not sure if it is, but….$91 OFF…..>>>>>.....?!!

Free ground shipping on 3 or more bottles.

93 points

“The 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon Old Rutherford is 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, aged 20 months in 70% new French oak. While it may come across as slightly more complex than the Juliet right now—it combines hints of dried herbs with a range of fruit that includes cassis as well as brighter berries—it's also more open-knit and forward. Full-bodied and concentrated, with a texture somewhere between velvety and coarse, this potent wine finishes with ample length and some dusty tannins.”

~Robert Parker's Wine Advocate

Throughout the years Beau Vigne Cabernet Sauvignon has strived for perfection, with wines that are meaningful, and of epic substance. It is our deep-rooted belief that our wine profoundly moves the most discerning drinkers. It is a philosophical journey with only one outcome, brilliance.

Previous Next

Technical Details

  • Country: USA
  • Region: Napa Valley
  • Varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon
  • Winemaker: Julien Fayard
  • Alcohol: 15%

About The Producer

Experience the power and depth of mountain fruit grown 1,400 ft above Napa Valley. Our prized estate vineyard atop Atlas Peak provides us with bold and luscious Cabernet Sauvignon. The portfolio is rounded out with a prestigious group of red blends, Pinot Noir, and Chardonnay sourced from the region’s top vineyards.

Old Rutherford is the epitome of Missouri Hopper Vineyard (year-over-year 96-99 point ratings). The utmost rarity because you can’t always get this fruit. It’s an outright bidding war and is reserved for some of the most expensive wines in Napa Valley. This is a steal on a hard to find vineyard.
